result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald D. Weston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of the Plea and Sentencing Hearing held on December 19, 2014 before the Honorable Sarah O Brien
Criminal Case Settlement

Cases 14CF340 & 14CF344 called together at 10:52 am [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for Arraignment)
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Gerald D. Weston in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Service of the Information admitted; reading waived

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1-14CF340; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 & #3-14CF340 & 14CF344

On Count #1-13CF340, the Court sentences Mr. Weston to 4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year and 6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years & 6 months. This sentence is to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being.

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 62 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid DL and Agent approval
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--To pay fine of $2000 + costs
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge

Conditions Not of Extended Supervision: 
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--County alcohol/drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device requirement/restrictions for:
 36 months
--6 demerit points assessed

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Recess: 11:23 am
Arraignment on December 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Cases 14CF340 & 14CF344 called together at 8:41 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Gerald D. Weston appears via video, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight & sound sufficient

BOTH CASES:
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Davidson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information; Atty Svehlek indicates that she does not have a copy of the information-requests setting arraignment over
Atty Svehlek orally motions for bond modification, presents arguments
Arguments by ADA Hall
Court presents basis and denies bond modification
Recess: 8:57 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Arraignment 12/19/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Waiver of Prelim on December 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Cases 14CF340 & 14CF344 called together at 8:45 am [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for WOPH)
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek in court. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Mr. Weston was scheduled for an out-patient procedure yesterday. Did receive information from the jail that Mr. Weston was admitted to the hospital and remains there. Unsure if there were complications with procedure if there was another issue. Did intend to waive preliminary hearing today in both matters; requests matters be reset in two weeks.
DA Happ: No objection
Court informs parties that the Court's JA also received same information from the jail
Recess: 8:47 am 

NEXT: BOTH CASES (1) Reschedule for WOPH 12/12/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Waiver of Prelim on November 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Cases 14CF340 & 14CF344 called together at 11:04 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Gerald D. Weston appears via video, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek who appears in court. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Svehlek: Had 1 pre-trial with State & have offer for resolution. Do need more time with the State. Requests matters be set for waiver of preliminary hearing next week and an additional DA PTC.
DA Happ: No objection, can set pre-trial after prelim. dates or just try informally
Recess: 11:06 am 

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) Schedule Waiver of Preliminary Hearing 11/14/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Amended (Bond to cover 14CF340 & 14CF344)

Cases 14CF340 & 14CF344 called at 3:01 pm
Defendant Gerald D. Weston in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Shock informs the Court that the State is ready to proceed.

Tim Taylor - sworn & testifies
-- direct exam by ADA Shock
-- cross exam by Attorney Svehlek

off record 3:32 pm 
back on record 3:32 pm

Court presents basis and finds the State has meet their burden.

Court orders $7,500.00 CASH bond to cover both files, with conditions
-Comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program
-No possession or consumption of alcohol
-No presence in any bars, taverns or liquor stores
-Not operate a motor vehicle
-No contact with Linette Schleef
-Not to leave the State of Wisconsin

recess: 3:42 pm

Cases 14CF340 and 14CF344 called at 9:05am. 
Defendant Gerald D. Weston in court with attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  Defendant Gerald D. Weston in custody.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews case history, status and filings - including the notice received from WCS indicating violation of SCRAM monitoring. 
State moves that the bond be modified from signature to cash; presents basis. 
Response presented by Atty. Svehlek. 
Statement presented by the defendant. 
Response presented by ADA Shock.
State requests an opportunity to contact WCS in an effort to present additional evidence related to the claim made by the defendant. 
Court will allow the State to contact WCS and have the case recalled later today. 

14CF340 ONLY -  Initial Appearance on Amended Complaint.
Service of the AMENDED Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
.

Recess 9:16am.  

NEXT:  
Case to be recalled at 3pm today.
Defendant in custody - Per JA Defendant is appearing in court, in custody tomorrow 10/21/14 in Br. 4/ Duplicate Original Warrant Documents returned by JCSD
Extradition forecast
For alleged violations of SCRAM monitoring (see attached.)  Upon arrest, the defendant is to be brought before Judge Koschnick for hearing only, not the intake court.
Notice of SCRAM violation with cover letter
States demand w/cover letter
Defendant's
Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek
Status conference on November 7, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 15, 2014 at 10:20 am.
Copy of  Previous Conflict Review Worksheet
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 1:15 pm
Defendant Gerald D. Weston in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews previous record regarding conflict review. 
Court verifies with Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charge and maximum penalties recited
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Count #1.
The Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.
 
Court requires $5,000.00 signature bond, with same conditions from 14CF340 and with amended SCRAM install date:
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-Not to drive
-No contact with Linette Schleef
-Not to leave the State of Wisconsin
-Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 10/2/14 at 2:00 pm.

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 1:23 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 10/15/14 at 10:20 am
Status: 11/7/14 at 11:00 am
